entry.title: Hardware Wallet Startup Cypherock Raises $1M to Skip Seed Phrases
entry.summary: The firm’s new hardware wallet uses NFC-based cards to reduce risks related to seed phrases.

entry.title: The Biggest NFT Collections of 2022
entry.summary: Punks? Apes? Azuki? Find out which projects racked up the largest trading tallies in an up-and-very-down year for NFTs.

entry.title: Who Lost the Least? Top Performing Crypto Assets of 2022
entry.summary: Bitcoin’s heavy price depreciation over the year was reflective of a general trend. Still, a few tokens weathered the industry storm well.

entry.title: Decrypt's 2022 Person of the Year: Sam Bankman-Fried
entry.summary: From plastering his own face onto billboards to facing criminal charges, SBF defined the year in crypto more than any other individual.

entry.title: 'Integrity Over Revenue' Says Paxful CEO After Booting Ethereum From Platform
entry.summary: The Paxful chief added tokens built atop Ethereum “have stolen valuable momentum away from Bitcoin and cost us years on our mission.”

entry.title: Gemini's Creditor Committee Presents Plan to Resolve Genesis, DCG ‘Liquidity Issues’
entry.summary: The Creditor Committee, which includes Gemini, has presented a "path for the recovery of assets" for the exchange's Earn users.

entry.title: EY ‘Did Not Initiate’ Transfers of $1.7M in Bitcoin Linked to Defunct QuadrigaCX
entry.summary: After years of dormancy, Bitcoin linked to QuadrigaCX is on the move. EY, overseeing the exchange’s bankruptcy, denies having any involvement.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Core Scientific Files for Chapter 11 Bankruptcy
entry.summary: Nasdaq-listed Bitcoin mining company Core Scientific has filed for Chapter 11 bankruptcy, citing low Bitcoin prices and high costs.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried May Be Back in the U.S. on Wednesday: Reports
entry.summary: The disgraced founder has been in the Bahamas since December 12 and previously planned to resist extradition.

entry.title: Portion of Bitcoin Supply Held by Retail Investors Reaches All-Time High: Glassnode
entry.summary: Retail investors are accumulating more and more Bitcoin, according to blockchain data from Glassnode, setting a new peak.

entry.title: Decrypt’s 2022 Crypto Project of the Year: Polygon
entry.summary: Mainstream brands like Starbucks, Reddit, and Instagram are adopting Polygon, and the Ethereum scaler is building for even broader adoption.

entry.title: Coinbase Stock Hits New Low, Down 87% From Start of 2022
entry.summary: The number one U.S. cryptocurrency exchange went public in April 2021.

entry.title: Major Democratic PAC to Return $3M in FTX Executive Donations: Report
entry.summary: FTX stated on Monday it may seek action in bankruptcy court against politicians who fail to return donations made by the defunct company

entry.title: Binance Joins US Crypto Lobbying Group Chamber of Digital Commerce
entry.summary: The move comes as U.S. lawmakers scramble to figure out how to regulate the fast-moving and complex sphere.

entry.title: Trump NFTs Tanking as Hype Dies, Floor Price Down 70%
entry.summary: The floor price for the former U.S. president’s Polygon-based NFTs has dropped 74% since peaking on Saturday.

entry.title: Bitcoin Miner Greenidge Says Continued Viability in ‘Substantial Doubt’
entry.summary: Greenidge is also working with NYDIG on new repayment terms, handing over a substantial portion of its mining machines in the process.

entry.title: BlockFi Petitions Bankruptcy Court to Let Clients Withdraw Blocked Assets
entry.summary: Importantly, the funds in question are those that were not stored in BlockFi’s flagship interest-bearing accounts.

entry.title: FTX Now Seeking 'Prompt Return' of Sam Bankman-Fried's Political Donations
entry.summary: The now-bankrupt FTX plans to recover political contributions from former management, even if the recipients donated funds to charities.

entry.title: ‘Financial Regulators Should Be Limited to Centralized Actors’: Coinbase CEO
entry.summary: The Coinbase CEO called for stricter regulations on centralized firms while promoting innovation for crypto-native technologies.

entry.title: What Are Proof of Reserves And Why Do They Matter?
entry.summary: Crypto’s latest obsession has been executing proof-of-reserve attestations. But what do they mean, and are all attestations created equal?

entry.title: Meta Says It Still Believes in Metaverse—Stock Is Down 64% Since Name Change
entry.summary: The social media giant has dumped billions into its nascent metaverse project so far, with little to show for it.

entry.title: Dogecoin Down 11% After Twitter Poll Says Elon Musk Should Leave CEO Post
entry.summary: The OG meme coin was long speculated to be a part of a planned Twitter-based wallet integration.

entry.title: Visa Teases Ethereum Collab, Aims to ‘Actively Contribute’ to Crypto Development
entry.summary: The payment company released a paper Monday exploring the potential for crypto auto-payments.

entry.title: Here Are the Sports Marketing Deals Crumbling Along With FTX
entry.summary: League of Legends maker Riot Games is the latest firm to act, asking the bankruptcy court to terminate its valuable esports deal.

entry.title: How Tezos Was Ahead of the Proof-of-Stake Merge: Web Summit 2022
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman talks about how the Tezos blockchain has used a proof-of-stake mechanism since its inception, her admiration for Tendermint, Ethereum and sharding, progressive decentralization, and NFT gaming with Decrypt's Stephen Graves onstage at Web Summit in Lisbon.

entry.title: Bitcoin Wallet Maker Foundation Raises $7M to Expand Self-Custody Push
entry.summary: The maker of the Passport hardware wallet, which promises "airgapped security," just raised a seed round to expand its product offerings.

entry.title: The Biggest Story in Crypto in 2022: Contagion—From Terra to FTX
entry.summary: It’s been a chaotic year in crypto—through it all, a single and brutal narrative thread has stood out.

entry.title: Epic Games to Pay $520M to FTC Over Fortnite 'Design Tricks,' Privacy Issues
entry.summary: The agency alleges that the metaverse builder misled users into spending money, and did not adequately protect children.

entry.title: gm: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Critiques SEC's Approach to Crypto
entry.summary: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce has been an outspoken advocate for crypto and a candid critic of her own agency’s approach to regulating crypto markets. In an extensive chat with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott she discussed FTX, Gary Gensler, DeFi, and the problems with the Howey Test. Don’t miss this conversation for the inside take on the SEC’s thinking on crypto—straight from the source. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: FTX Founder Sam Bankman-Fried Changes His Mind on Extradition to US
entry.summary: The disgraced crypto mogul said he would no longer fight extradition, but was sent back to prison amid courtroom confusion.

entry.title: How Balancer DAO Achieved Peace With a Clever Whale Named Humpy
entry.summary: Balancer's whale problem has ended with a peace treaty, but Humpy's attack raises key questions about crypto governance.

entry.title: Grayscale Weighs Tender Offer for 20% of Shares in Its Deeply-Discounted Bitcoin Trust
entry.summary: If the SEC again blocks Grayscale's attempts to convert its Bitcoin product into an ETF, the firm has other options to help investors.

entry.title: Binance US to Acquire Bankrupt Voyager's Assets for $1 Billion
entry.summary: Voyager announced that Binance.US has emerged "as the highest and best bid" for the now-bankrupt firm's assets.

entry.title: Bored Ape Creator Yuga Labs Nabs New CEO From Gaming Giant Activision Blizzard
entry.summary: Daniel Alegre heeds the call of duty to leave a stalled Microsoft acquisition to helm Otherside development.

entry.title: Banking Committee Chair: US Regulators Should ‘Maybe’ Ban Crypto
entry.summary: Senator Sherrod Brown added, though, that banning cryptocurrencies would be “very difficult” as activity would go offshore.

entry.title: Metaverse Tokens Flow, Apecoin Plummet Double-Digits Over The Week
entry.summary: Despite several bullish metrics in the NFT market, metaverse tokens, like the rest of the industry, still can’t shake the Fed.

entry.title: Imprisoned Sam Bankman-Fried May Relent in Extradition Fight: Reports
entry.summary: After four days facing "harsh" conditions in a Bahamanian prison, SBF may be open to returning to the USA.

entry.title: SEC Commissioner Hester Peirce Outlines Problems With the SEC’s Howey Test
entry.summary: The "Crypto Mom" says the oft-cited standard doesn’t fully address the status of decentralized crypto assets.

entry.title: 2022 Was Supposed to Be the Year of the Metaverse. What Went Wrong?
entry.summary: Billions of dollars flooded into the development of an immersive version of the internet. Are we there yet?

entry.title: This Week on Crypto Twitter: SBF Arrested! Binance Withdrawals Spike! Former President Pitches NFTs!
entry.summary: The industry kept a beleaguered Twitter buzzing this week with not one, but three talking points.

entry.title: Inside Nigeria's Ambitious Push of Cashless Society, eNaira CBDC
entry.summary: Nigeria is capping cash withdrawals in order to drive adoption of its CBDC the eNaira—but will people embrace the central bank’s vision?

entry.title: Trump NFT Prices Nosedive, Then Soar, as SNL Skewers Them
entry.summary: The floor price of the former president’s “digital trading cards” hit a pothole over the weekend.

entry.title: gm: Tezos Co-Founder Kathleen Breitman Sounds Off on FTX Collapse
entry.summary: Tezos co-founder Kathleen Breitman has been in crypto since the beginning and has seen a lot of cycles and failures. She joined Stacy Elliott and Dan Roberts and brought the fire on FTX and Sam Bankman-Fried’s mismanagement, “decentralization theater,” Tezos’s reputation and positioning, crypto sports marketing, and NFTs. Watch Episode 25 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Raising in a Bear Market: Slow Ventures, Volt Capital, Conviction, AngelBlock at 0xpo Summit
entry.summary: Clay Robbins of Slow Ventures, Soona Amhaz of Volt Capital, Sarah Guo of Conviction and formerly Greylock, and Alex Strzesniewski of AngelBlock joined Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Summit in San Francisco on November 3 for an extensive panel on raising venture money even during Crypto Winter.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Bored Ape Yacht Club Wins NFT Project of the Year
entry.summary: Illa Da Producer accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Yuga Labs from presenter Alanna Roazzi-Laforet at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Moonbirds, Azuki, DeGods, and CloneX.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Art Blocks Founder Wins Industry Achievement Award
entry.summary: Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon accepted the industry achievement award from presenter Clara Tsao of Filecoin Foundation at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: BFF Wins Diversity Award
entry.summary: Rachel Weiss and Jackie Courtney accepted the Cryptie for BFF from presenter Rebecca Barkin of Lamina1 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were WomenRise, Boys Club, and The Hug.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Crypto Unicorns Wins Game of the Year
entry.summary: Katrina Wolfe accepted the Cryptie for Crypto Unicorns from presenter Avery Akkineni of Vayner3 at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Stepn, Zed Run, and Blankos Block Party.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Celo Wins Social Impact Award
entry.summary: Marek Olszewski accepted the Cryptie for Celo from presenter Dan Roberts of Decrypt Media at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Ukraine DAO, Dream DAO, Proof of Protest, and Digital Diaspora.

entry.title: The Crypties 2022: Doodles Collab With Shopify Wins Mainstream Award
entry.summary: Shirley Cedeno and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie on behalf of Doodles from presenters Igor Lilic and Gabriela Ramos Lilic of Breakout at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were RTFKT and Nike, Gmoney and Adidas, Tiffany and CryptoPunks, and TIMEpieces.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: People of Crypto Wins Metaverse Event of the Year
entry.summary: Simone Berry and Akbar Hamid accepted the Cryptie for People of Crypto's Metaverse Pride Parade from presenter Toni Thai Sterrett of Bad Grrls Creative Club at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Decentraland's Metaverse Fashion Week and Heal from The Sandbox and Code Green.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Lens Protocol Wins DeFi Project of the Year
entry.summary: Bradley Freeman and Christina Beltramini accepted the Cryptie for Lens Protocol from presenter Jordan Garbis of BeetsDAO at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Aave, dYdX, and OlympusDAO.

entry.title: The Crypties Awards 2022: Coinbase Ventures Wins Investor of the Year
entry.summary: Shan Aggarwal accepted the Cryptie for Coinbase Ventures from presenter Amanda Cassatt of Serotonin at the inaugural Crypties Awards from Decrypt Studios in Miami on November 30. The other nominees in the category were Paradigm, a16z, and Polychain.

entry.title: Blocknative CEO Matt Cutler at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: Blocknative's Matt Cutler sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to tell his Web3 origin story and Blocknative's business—plus misconceptions in the crypto space.

entry.title: Fintech Lawyer: Crypto Companies Need to Seek Legal Advice Before Launch
entry.summary: Lisa Rubin, a blockchain attorney with Paul Hastings, sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss legal misconceptions the industry still holds.

entry.title: Phantom Co-Founder Francesco Agosti at 0xpo Crossroads
entry.summary: One of the minds behind the popular Solana dapp sits down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at 0xpo Crossroads in San Francisco on November 3 to discuss the history of Phantom and what he’s looking forward to in Web3.
